page.title: 05SEATON CARNIVAL
page.content: Seaton carnival, dating from the beginning of this century,is held on the second Saturday ofJune. Preparation begins in December. The commitee of 12 will spend Â£1500. On the day, the judges give prizes for the best queen's float, the best tableau,the open float from outside Seaton,and many other novelty entries. There is a prize for the best overall entry, and for the best entertainment. There is a strict hierarchy amongst the queens, who graduate from Gipsy to Carnival to retiring queen to Britannia. Dancing exhibitions and many bands make this a very joyful and noisy affair enjoyed hugely by all. Over 1000 free teas are handed out to children and on nearby Jackson St. field there is a fair.
